title: Oh good , the first nerf to elixers is to the tank elixer.
body:
Not to the mage or AD elixer which are the ones bought consistently every single game. No, the first nerf goes to the tank elixer. Which is barely ever bought. 

Riot is very consistent if nothing else.

replies.body: "how dare they bug fix 100% tenacity irelia"
um.. This was a thing? Tenacity had diminishing returns last I heard. I thought getting over 70% was suppose to be hard just for Irelia mainly.
Partially true. Iron used to add tenacity (which doesn't cause diminishing returns), not multiply it (which would cause the diminishing returns).

Interesting. Sorry I haven't played lately so I didn't hear about this. 

I am amazed nobody saw this coming honestly.
Tenacity normally has diminishing returns but the elixer didn't. This change made the elixer also have diminishing returns so Irelia couldn't get a better Olaf ult in teamfights.

Could they have just changed the interaction between Irelia and the elixer? It wasn't broken on anyone else that comes to mind.

Oh well.

You forget this girl that also has some kind of tenacity on her kit {{champion:113}} Specially if you go {{item:3009}} {{item:3725}} {{item:2138}} tenacious mastery and swiftness plus her 25% reduced effects of slow in her passive it was practically a Master Yi Ult all the time. Even if you landed a slow it will last like 0.5 sec which would be laughable compared to her 2 sec slow on E.
Shhhhhh or they will nerf my preciousssssss {{item:3070}}
Can  we bug fix 30% lifesteal ADCs and Zed?

>
> Can  we bug fix 30% lifesteal ADCs and Zed?

It's only 10% assuming you are talking about Elixir of Wrath

Half the duration if you die while it is activated and remove the AD it gives you. Everything else about it is neat though.
You could get 100% tenacity on Irelia with the tank elixir. That's why they changed it.

> [{quoted}](name=ShenKichin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tMmNeBw5,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-01-28T08:26:08.308+0000)
>
> You could get 100% tenacity on Irelia with the tank elixir. That's why they changed it.

darn it

They found out.

Not 100%.

But 90%, which is enough to reduce all CC below the level where you can really notice it.

Well though there are still all these knock up and knock backs all over the place and stuff
but yeah pretty op
If only i knew this earlier {{item:3070}}{{champion:39}}{{item:3070}}
So what you're saying is they thought they better nerf irelia?
Honestly surprised it hasn't been said yet, bonus points to you.
Where did you get info on which elixir is bought more then others?
I see Iron waaaaaaaay more than the other ones
I usually just get iron to make myself look big. :D
And that is why it is seen the most often.

I once got Iron on Viktor simply because steel is an alloy of iron and carbon (with small quantities of other elements) and "Steel can fix all your flaws!"  

I was also incredibly fed (like 27/2/13) that game and could insta-kill most of the enemy team even without an elixir.  Wanted to mess around a bit that game, and when I told my friend (and teammate that game) why I had it, his groan made everything I sacrificed worth it.  ^_^

>
> I see Iron waaaaaaaay more than the other ones

Ditto.

I'm pretty sure its cuz it makes you nice and big

*at night*

The problem was that {{item:2138}} was better on certain bruisers than on Tanks anyways, haha.

Honestly, tanks can go for {{item:2138}} or {{item:2139}} if you want more damage. Since the sorcery adds true damage and not much scaling, it's great on tanks with AoE and can use the extra AP!
Honestly, I'm buying the tank one more often and earlier than the other ones. The one I rarely buy is the Ruin one
hehehe, ruin+ zz'rot = cruelty to turrets
The Ruin one is the only one I buy before my full build. I just usually forget to use it when I get it.

That additive tenacity buff is overpowered.

70% reduction in CC duration. That 2 second stun is now .6 seconds.

Heck you would not even know you got stunned from a Riven.

Oh yeah that Irelia 100% tenacity is broken.

Yeah, not like my last game consisted of 3 enemies buying Iron Elixir or anything!

I, personally, preferred Elixir of Ruin for actual HP rather than the "FOCUS ME HARDER' size increase but I play fighters when I'm forced to...

Was nerfed because of Irelia, it seems.

But tanks suffer more...
It wasn't working properly at first stance, so it's a fix rather than a nerf

That's not the only tank-ish thing they nerfed.

{{item:3512}} 

... It didn't even get popular... 

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/hEt0yERb-i-feel-depressed-zzrot-portal-feedback

They nerfed elixir of Ruin?  The bastards!

Oh just The 100% Irelia tenacity potion?  Remind me why this was a problem again?

lmfao i actually did this on irelia with a friend in KR/
its hilarious
rammus+ fiddle fear/taunt dont even exist it feels like lmao.
because someone who can stroll through all forms of cc is balanced.
I build it on Cho'Gath, but exclusively for shits and giggles, sorcery is WAY better for tanks since it makes them impossible to ignore.

Considering Irelia is a big issue with the Elixer, why not make changes that only affect her and some other champs that turn it into something anti-fun overpowered? Instead of nerfing the entire goddamn tank item....once again.

I think it was a warranted nerf, but that doesn't mean we shouldn't nerf the others. Take away the rests on Wrath, for example. It heals for 10% of ALL physical damage and refreshes on kill or assist for another block of time. It's stupid. 


Iron's still a great elixir for {{champion:31}} though, just to make the dragon shit its pants whenever you walk down the river.

> Iron's still a great elixir for {{champion:31}} though, just to make the dragon shit its pants whenever you walk down the river.

Why do some people want to ruin every fun thing in the game?
Nah I like fun things in the game. Resets aren't one of them though. They only let the user have fun at the expense of everything else.

ITT: People don't know what Elixir of Iron is and keeps calling it Elixir of Ruin.

/facepalm
This change is a nerf except when you don't get tenacity from other items. However, this change is also worth it for the clarity because it being changed to work just like other forms of tenacity.
It sounds to me like they should have had it work this way in the first place.
I bought wrath on every ad character (sometimes not irelia) so change is inconsequential for me. Wrath elixir's refresh effect is so good especially if you're ahead. Full snowball potential.
Well it isn't actually a nerf if you don't have any other forms of tenacity (though if you really are a full tank you probably have the tenacity from the masteries)

So instead of putting a cap on tenacity which would be the logical thing, they nerf another tank thing just because one champ could get close to 100% of a stat that should really just cap at 50 or so? Fucking genius. I think riot is just taking the piss at this point, because there's just no way. They're rapidly approaching full retard.
